adminPlugin.message: This DAO is governed by admins. They can make changes to the DAO without a proposal.

error.file-invalid-type: The selected file type is not supported. Upload a valid image file (e.g., PNG, JPG, GIF).
error.file-too-large: The file size exceeds the maximum allowed limit of 1 MB.
error.square-only: The image must be square. Upload a square image.
error.too-many-files: Only one file can be uploaded at a time.
error.wrong-dimension: The image dimensions exceed the maximum allowed size of 1024x1024 pixels.

avatar.helpText: JPG, PNG, or GIF of no more than 1 MB and less than 1024x1024px.
avatar.label: Logo

description.helpText: This is shown on the DAO's dashboard and the Explore page so visitors can easily find you.
description.label: Description

ens.helpText: This is a custom onchain identifier for your DAO. It can be used in URLs to access your DAO as well as send assets.
ens.label: ENS subname

resources.helpText: These are shown as links on the DAO dashboard. They are best suited for your website, social media, or other communication channels.

network.helpText: The chain you choose is where your tokens and assets are stored.
network.label: Select chain

METADATA.description: Describe your DAO so visitors know they've come to the right place. Any of these fields can be changed later via governance.

METADATA.title: Describe your DAO

NETWORK.description: The chain you choose is where your DAO and tokens will be deployed. If you already have a token, select the chain your token is on.
NETWORK.name: Select chain
NETWORK.title: Select chain

createProcessDetailsDialog.description: Governance should suit your DAO's needs. Whether it's for asset management, protocol upgrades, or team coordination, you can add a new governance process at any time.
createProcessDetailsDialog.title: Create governance process

error.required: A body must be added to this process.

basicBodyField.helpText: Add the governing body that get to determine whether or not proposal passes.
basicBodyField.label: Voting body

approve.helpText: The number of bodies that must approve this proposal to advance it.
approve.label: Approval threshold

veto.helpText: The number of bodies that must veto this proposal to stop it from advancing.
veto.label: Veto threshold

error.required: At least one body must be added to the stage.

stageBodiesField.helpText: These bodies will decide whether or not this stage passes.

name.helpText: This is used to identify the stage the proposal is in. For example: Community Review, Guardian Veto, or Founder Signoff
name.label: Stage name

stageTypeField.helpText: This will determine the role that governance plays in the stage.
stageTypeField.label: Stage type

NORMAL.description: Proposals pass this stage only if approved.
NORMAL.label: Normal

OPTIMISTIC.description: Proposals pass this stage unless vetoed.
OPTIMISTIC.label: Optimistic

TIMELOCK.description: Proposals pass this stage after the timelock period.
TIMELOCK.label: Timelock

BASIC.description: Proposals are decided on by a single body.
BASIC.label: Basic

type.helpText: This determines the amount of control and flexibility you need to design your governance process.
type.label: Governance Designer

description.helpText: This is shown on the proposals list.
description.label: Description

processKey.helpText: The key is part of the unique identifier for proposals of this type. Something like EIP would lead to EIP-1 and increment for each proposal.
processKey.label: Key

resources.helpText: These are shown as links on the proposal list. They can be used to help visitors understand the {{type}}.

bodies.error: You must select at least one body.
bodies.label: Bodies

METADATA.description: Describe the governance process so visitors understand its purpose and how decisions are made. Any of these fields can be changed later via governance.

METADATA.title: Describe new proposal type

PERMISSIONS.description: Define who can create proposals of this type.
PERMISSIONS.name: Proposal creation rules
PERMISSIONS.title: Set proposal creation rules

STAGES.description: Design how decisions are made in this type of proposal. A proposal can go through multiple sequential stages and have any number of governing bodies.
STAGES.name: Governance design
STAGES.title: Design the governance process

a11y.description: Create a new voting body for your DAO

address.helpText: Add any address as a body, such as a Safe or Governor
address.label: External address

resources.helpText: These are shown as links on the members list.

summary.helpText: This is shown on the members list to help visitors understand what the body is responsible for.

external.description: Add any address as a body, such as a Safe or Governor
external.label: External address

plugin.helpText: This determines the governance the body uses to make decisions.

a11y.description: Configure the duration and expiration for the stage

earlyAdvance.helpText: This allows a proposal to be advanced early to subsequent stages if it's approved before the voting period ends.
earlyAdvance.label: Early stage advance

expiration.helpText: This limits the amount of time after the voting period ends for advancing the proposal to the next stage.
expiration.infoText: Recommended minimum expiration time is 7 days.
expiration.label: Stage expiration

timelockPeriod.helpText: The time that must pass before the proposal can advance.
timelockPeriod.label: Timelock period

votingPeriod.helpText: This is amount of time bodies in this stage have to vote on proposals.
votingPeriod.infoText: Recommended minimum voting period is 7 days.
votingPeriod.label: Voting period

connect.description: To connect, open the dApp, copy the WalletConnect QR code to your clipboard, and paste it here.
connect.title: Connect to dApp

listener.info_2: on behalf of your DAO. Instead of going to your wallet, transactions will be made available to add as actions to the proposal.

dialog.description: Add or remove the addresses that should be able to make any change to the DAO without a proposal.
dialog.title: Manage admins

adminPublishManageMembersDialog.description: To update admins, confirm the onchain transaction in your wallet.
adminPublishManageMembersDialog.title: Update admins

adminUninstallProcessDialogCreate.description: To remove all admins, you need to first create at least one other governance process for your DAO.
adminUninstallProcessDialogCreate.heading: No governance process found
adminUninstallProcessDialogCreate.label: Create governance process
adminUninstallProcessDialogCreate.title: Remove all admins

a11y.description: You have to create and pass a proposal in another governance process to remove admin control from the DAO. This should only be done when the DAO is ready and no longer requires admin control.

adminUninstallProcessDialogSelect.descriptionFirstLine: You have to create and pass a proposal in another governance process to remove admin control from the DAO.
adminUninstallProcessDialogSelect.descriptionSecondLine: This should only be done when the DAO is ready and no longer requires admin control.
adminUninstallProcessDialogSelect.title: Remove all admins

adminVotingTerminal.description: Proposals created by admins pass automatically without any governance.
adminVotingTerminal.title: Automatic execution

endTime.helpText: After a proposal expires, you can't approve or execute it.
endTime.infoText: It’s recommended to have an expiration time of {{days}} days to maintain a clean proposal list.
endTime.label: Expiration time

startTime.helpText: This is the time that the proposal becomes available for approvals.
startTime.label: Approval start time

alert.majority: Proposal will be approved by majority
alert.minority: Proposals could be approved by a minority rather than a majority.

minimumApproval.helpText: At least this many members will have to approve proposals.
minimumApproval.label: Approval threshold

multisigSetupMembership.helpText: These addresses will be the only ones able to participate

item.alreadyMember: Address is already a member of the DAO

multisigSetupMembership.label: Members

setup.description: Designated members must reach a minimum approval threshold
setup.name: Multisig

advanceStageDialog.description: To advance the proposal to the next stage, confirm the onchain transaction in your wallet.
advanceStageDialog.title: Advance proposal

startTime.helpText: The first stage's voting period begins at this time.
startTime.label: Stage 1 start time

sppInvalidAddressConnectedDialog.description: Please connect a wallet that is eligible to vote. If you are an owner of this external address you can connect with WalletConnect to vote on this proposal.
sppInvalidAddressConnectedDialog.title: Not eligible to vote

sppReportProposalResultDialog.description: To submit your vote, confirm the onchain transaction in your wallet.
sppReportProposalResultDialog.title: Submit vote

sppVotingTerminalBodyVoteDefault.helpText: If you are an owner of this address you can connect with WalletConnect to vote on this proposal.

pending.description: Starts once the previous stage is advanced
pending.heading: Timelock pending

setup.description: Majority voting based on token voting power
setup.name: Token voting

tokenApproveTokensDialog.description: To approve wrapping your tokens, confirm the onchain transaction in your wallet.
tokenApproveTokensDialog.title: Approve wrapping

endTime.infoText: The minimum duration is {{days}} days, {{hours}} hours, and {{minutes}} minutes, set by DAO governance.
endTime.label: Voting duration / end time

delegate.helpText: Enter the address where you want to delegate your current or future token balance's voting power.
delegate.label: Your delegation

dialog.description: To delegate to this address, confirm the onchain transaction in your wallet.
dialog.title: Delegate

tokenDelegationForm.info: Delegating increases the voting power of the address above by your balance. If you delegate to someone else, you can't vote until you reclaim your voting power.

selection.label: Who would you like to delegate to?

tokenGovernanceSettings.proposalAccess: Members with ≥ {{balance}} {{symbol}} voting power or balance

tokenProposalCreationSettings.helpText: The voting power or token balance required to create proposals.
tokenProposalCreationSettings.label: Minimum requirement

earlyExecution.helpText: Allows a proposal to be executed before the voting period ends. This is only possible if the proposal meets the support threshold, satisfies the minimum participation, and can’t be overturned by remaining voters.
earlyExecution.label: Early execution

eligibleField.helpText: Specify who can create proposals and the minimum token requirement.
eligibleField.label: Who is eligible

members.description: Only members with at least this much voting power or token balance can create proposals.
members.label: Members

minDuration.alertInfo: Ensure members have enough time to vote. It's recommended to set this to at least 1 day.
minDuration.helpText: The shortest time a proposal is open for voting. Proposals can have a longer duration but not shorter.
minDuration.label: Minimum duration

minParticipation.helpText: The percentage of tokens that participate in a proposal, out of the total supply, must be greater than or equal to this value.
minParticipation.label: Minimum participation

minVotingPower.helpText: Only members with at least this much voting power or token balance can create proposals.
minVotingPower.label: Minimum requirement

alert.majority: Proposal will be approved by majority
alert.minority: Proposals could be approved by a minority rather than a majority.

supportThreshold.helpText: The percentage of tokens that vote 'Yes' in support of a proposal, out of all tokens that have voted, must be greater than this value.
supportThreshold.label: Support threshold

voteChange.helpText: Allows voters to change their vote during the voting period. This prevents the body from giving early approval or veto.
voteChange.label: Vote change

name.helpText: These addresses will receive newly minted tokens.
name.label: Token name

symbol.helpText: This is the abbreviated ticker of the token. For example: UNI
symbol.label: Token symbol

notErc20Compatible.description1: The address isn’t a valid ERC-20 address and therefore can't be used in governance.

notGovernanceCompatible.description1: This token must be wrapped by its holders to be used in governance.
notGovernanceCompatible.description2: Token holders will be able to wrap their tokens at any time to receive equivalent governance tokens, which can be used to vote on proposals. They can unwrap at any time to receive their original tokens.

importToken.helpText: The address of the token to be imported
importToken.label: Token address
importToken.placeholder: Enter the token address to import

type.helpText: You can either import an existing ERC-20 token to be used in governance or create a new one.
type.label: ERC-20 token

options.label: Do you want to {{label}} this proposal?

tokenWrapForm.footerInfo: Wrapping tokens will transfer them out of your wallet to the wrapping contract, where they can be withdrawn back to your wallet at any time.
tokenWrapForm.info: Wrap {{underlyingSymbol}} to increase your voting power.

unwrap.description: To unwrap your tokens, confirm the onchain transaction in your wallet.
unwrap.title: Unwrap tokens

wrap.description: To wrap your tokens, confirm the onchain transaction in your wallet.
wrap.title: Wrap tokens

confirmWizardExit.message: If you leave this process, you'll lose all the information you've entered so far.

errorFeedback.description: If you'd like to help, you can report the issue to our team.
errorFeedback.title: Something went wrong

invalid.description: Some values are invalid. Review and fix them to proceed.
invalid.title: Invalid data

invalid-required.description: Some inputs are missing or invalid. Fix them to proceed.
invalid-required.title: Missing and invalid data

required.description: Some inputs are missing. Fill out all mandatory fields to proceed.
required.title: Missing data
